subject: Re: [junit] How can i test a geter or seter?
msgSnippet: Not so, XP says test anything and everything that could possibly break.  It doesn t specify HOW it could break, just that it could.  I stand on my earlier

Not so, XP says "test anything and everything that could possibly break."  It
doesn't specify HOW it could break, just that it could.  I stand on my earlier
comment.  Having done XP for almost two years, I have actually seen this to be
the case and been saved because there was a test as well as been bitten because
there wasn't.  So...

-jason
--- Nilesh Thali <nilesh.thali@...> wrote:
> > -----------------------------------------
> >              Keep it simple...
> > (1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
> 
> Exactly the philosophy of eXtreme Programming where JUnit probably has its
> roots.
> Instead of predicting what the function will do in the future, it's
> preferable to
> work
> with the present, and not have a test for it. If and when it changes to a
> more
> complex
> implementation, by all means, add a test.
> regards,
> Nilesh
> 
> 


=====
-----------------------------------------
             Keep it simple...
(1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
